lines.text: Your name is Rudolph, you're a freak with a red nose, and no one likes you. Then, one day, Santa picks you and you save Christmas. No, forget that part. We'll improvise... just keep it kind of loosey-goosey. You HATE Christmas! You're gonna steal it. Saving Christmas is a lousy ending, way too commercial. ACTION!
BRILLIANT! You reject your own nose because it represents the glitter of commercialism. Why didn't I think of that? Cut, print, check the gate, moving on.

00, wrestle with my self-loathing... I'm booked. Of course, if I bump the loathing to 9, I could still be done in time to lay in bed, stare at the ceiling and slip slowly into madness. But what would I wear?
I tell you Max, I don't know why I ever leave this place. I've got all the company I need right here.
Oh right, that's REALLY mature, saying exactly what I say.

[whispering]
Alright fine! I'm not talking to you anymore! In fact, I'm going to whisper! So that by the time my voice reverbarates off the walls, and gets back to me, I won't be able to hear it.

[Grinch's voice]
If you utter so much as one syllable, I'LL HUNT YOU DOWN AND GUT YOU LIKE A FISH! If you'd like to fax me, press the star key.
It's because I'm green isn't it?
Don't forget the Grinch. I know he's mean and hairy and smelly. His hands might be cold and clammy, but I think he's actually kinda... sweet.
Nice kid... baaad judge of character.

[startled to see The Grinch collapse on his sleigh]
Are you all right?
Are you kiddin'? The sun is bright and the powder is bitchin'!
The Whos young and old would sit down to a feast, and they'll feast, and they'll feast.
And they'll feast, feast, feast, feast. They'll eat their Who-Pudding and rare Who-Roast Beast. But that's something I just cannot stand in the least. Oh, no. I'M SPEAKING IN RHYME!
Now you listen to me, young lady! Even if we're *horribly mangled*, there'll be no sad faces on Christmas.
Am I just eating because I'm bored?

That's what it's all about, isn't it? That's what it's always been *about*. Gifts, gifts... gifts, gifts, gifts, gifts, gifts! You wanna know what happens to your gifts? They all come to me. In your garbage. You see what I'm saying? In your *garbage*. I could hang myself with all the bad Christmas neckties I found at the dump. And the avarice...

The avarice never ends! "I want golf clubs. I want diamonds. I want a pony so I can ride it twice, get bored and sell it to make glue." Look, I don't wanna make waves, but this *whole* Christmas season is...
There is, however, one teeny-tiny Christmas tradition I find quite meaningful...
Now pucker up and kiss it, Whoville!
He looks just like your boss.
They fed you, they clothed you, and here they are today! Your old biddies!
We're gonna die! We're gonna die! I'm going to throw up, and then I'm gonna die! Mommy, tell it to stop!
[continues to scream and yell, then chuckle as he gets the sleigh under control]
Whew... ha! Almost lost my *cool* there.

[after getting bit on the butt by Max]
That is not a chew toy. You have no idea where it's been.
Oh. Bleeding hearts of the world UNITE.

[kisses the Grinch on the cheek]
Your cheek's so...
Greasy? Stinky? Do I have a zit?
I'm all toasty inside. And I'm leaking.

[messing with peoples mail]
Jury duty, jury duty, jury duty, black mail, pink slip, chain letter, eviction notice, jury duty.
One man's toxic sludge is another man's potpourri.
I don't know, it's some kind of soup.
I am the Grinch that stole Christmas... and I'm sorry.
Aren't you going to cuff me? Put me in a choke hole? Blind me with pepper spray?
You heard him, Officer. He admitted it. I'd go with the pepper spray.
Yes, I heard him all right. He said he was sorry.
It came without ribbons. It came without tags. It came without packages, boxes, or bags.
The the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before.
Maybe Christmas doesn't come from a store. Maybe Christmas...
So whatever the reason, his heart or his shoes, he stood outside his cave, hating the Whos.
Aaron B. Benson Who, I hate *you*.
Hate, hate, hate. Hate, hate, hate. Double hate. LOATHE ENTIRELY!
Did I have a crush on the Grinch? Of COURSE not.
Uh... I didn't ask you that.
Inside a snowflake like the one on your sleeve, there happened a story you must see to believe.
Santa, what's the meaning of Christmas?

[calmly]
Er, I mean... presents, I suppose.
Blast this Christmas music. It's joyful and triumphant.
Oh, no, the sleigh, the presents, they'll be destroyed, and I care!

[after sons have said they had seen the Grinch]
I'm sure they were just up on Mount Crumpit... playing with matches... defacing public property or something or other.
[Cindy meets the Grinch for the first time]

[stops a tiny car]
Evening, folks. Mind if I squeeze in?
You might want to scooch over.
And the more the Grinch thought of what Christmas would bring, the more the Grinch thought...
I must stop this whole thing!
Why, for year after year I've put up with it now. I must stop this Christmas from coming... but how? I MEAN... in what way?

[Takes back his mask and barks at Cindy Lou]
Give me that! Don't you know you're not suppose to take things that don't belong to you? What's the matter with you, you some kind of wild animal? Huh?
Those Whos are hard to frazzle, Max. But, we did our worst, and that's all that matters.
Let's see, we've got a munkle for your uncle, a fant for your aunt and a fandpa for your Cousin Leon.

[singing]
Be it ever so heinous, there's no place like home.

[stops in his tracks]
Saving you, is that what you think I was doing? Wrongo. I just noticed that you were improperly packaged, my dear.
[grabs wrapping paper and starts wrapping Cindy up]
Can I use your finger for a sec?
Hello? Is my Subzero Chillibrator running? I suppose.
Well then you better go catch it.
For the next 5 minutes only, 99% off!
And if you marry me, you get this new car, which has been generously paid for by the taxpayers of Whoville.
Are you having a holly, jolly Christmas?
He had hair. Not pleasant. He shed. Not right.
You don't have a chance with her. You're eight years old and you have a BEARD!
Well, pucker up and kiss it, Whoville.
[puts mistletoe up to his butt and makes a taunting noise as he shakes it around]
Are you ready, Drew? I'll race you! Last one up is a stinky old Grinch.
Guys, where are we? I think we should go back.
What? You're scared of The Grinch!
They say he lives inside the mountain, waiting to feast on... WHO-FLESH!
You're scared of the Grinch! You're scared of The Grinch!
[they come to the door, Stu and Drew are bit taken back]
Oh, come on touch it. Touch the door! Do it for me, Stu.
Everybody seems to kerbabbled. Isn't this just a little superfluous?

[Lou standing in the way of the Sleigh]
Daddy, move!

[his plan to ruin Christmas for the Whos]
The crescendo of my odious opus.
